Satisfactory has successfully integrated the best aspect of adventure, shooter and builder games in an unbelievably diverse and beautiful world. This is the Sandbox you've been waiting for.
its fun
Great Game Best Factory Game (that i have played)

Satisfactory is one of those games that completely grabs your attention. The moment you start building, you just want to keep going. The world is beautiful and exploring it is fun, but the real satisfaction comes from watching your factory grow and become more complex over time.

Everything feels solid and smooth. The building system is smart and gives you the freedom to plan things the way you want. It feels really good to see things working exactly how you imagined. Sometimes it takes a while to figure out how to connect everything in the most efficient way, but that process is part of the fun.

The sound design and music are also great. They help create the right atmosphere while you work on your next big project. Even when I am just standing still and looking at everything I built, it feels rewarding.

I keep coming back to this game because there is always something new I want to try. A new layout. A better power system. A new goal to reach. It keeps me thinking and planning even when I am not playing.

I definitely recommend it.

Nice game untill the late game. Getting Phase 5 I got in crashing loop. After a small research I found out that errors appear due to the memory leak ("malllock", "arrays out size", "cannot multiple matrices", etc.). That's amazing, because people keep reporting such errors FOR A F*CKING YEAR. AND NOBODY FIX IT.... So your chance to play late game 50/50. Somebody says the cause of it is "staring vertical conveyor belts", but its nonsense. And not settings changes helps. GG WP. game is good. one of the best open-world, factory/automation games. theres two playstyles you can do. 

1.) Your factory and production is nice and neat, organized. There is storage for each item. You can easily tell what is going on by looking at your conveyor belts and looking at the map.

2.) there is spaghetti everywhere. buildings are clipping into each other, all you see is belts twisting, turning, going through other belts, you start losing your mind but somehow it works.

Do you like optimising the living crap out of everything but also want nice visuals and a first-person experience (as opposed to things like Factorio or some [still excellent] mobile games)? Then this is the game for you!
The studio (Coffee Stain Studio) are amazing and have listened to the community throughout development and have been quite transparent with features and considerations. Also, the modding scene/community is quite big and the more popular mods integrate more or less as if they're part of the stock game!

The Factory must grow.

[h1]Sublime distraction for the engineering mind.[/h1]

The game is a sandbox with a story and light direction, but not so much story and direction that you're on rails.   Still, the learning curve is easy.  You become a sophisticated factory engineer effortlessly.  There are always several things to do and explore.

The factory mechanics are solid, and you have lots of options for building beautiful sci-fi structures to compliment a beautiful sci-fi world.

Gameplay: 10 (fun, very fun)
Graphics: 9 (beautiful without needing a $700 GPU)
Sound: 7 (adequate, I turn the music off)
Stability: 7 (Easy to push the game engine limits, crashes are never catastrophic though)
Replayability: 9 (Hundreds of hours of bliss for $30)
Story: 7 (The story is mostly just about what you do, and that is fine)

As a Mechanical Engineering Technologist, I absolutely love this game, Despite absolutely hating the fact that the factory I just built for 3 hours was the worst way to build the factory, but that's also what I love with this game. The ability to constantly improve and experiment constantly is what makes the game so much fun and when you complete your factories you get to see your build come to life which is extremely rewarding.

I find myself constantly returning to the game to play some more, and I don't see myself stopping anytime soon.
This game is genuinely so addicting. Bought the game and then sat down and played 5 hours straight.
